root.message: The COVERAGE field for indicator 3-7-2, translated into en
root.data:
Data availability:

Data selected for the adolescent birth rate for women aged 10-14 years and 15-19 years are available for 215 and 225 countries or areas, respectively, for the 2000-2020 time period. For 219 countries or areas, there are at least two available data points. Only six countries have one data point for women aged 10-14 years, one in Europe and Northern America (Isle of Man), one in Eastern and South-eastern Asia (Democratic Republic of Korea), one in Central Asia and Southern Asia (Bhutan), one in Western Asia and Nothern Africa (Lebanon) and two in Latin America and the Caribbean (Saint-Barthélemy, and Saint Kitts and Nevis). Only four countries have one data point for women aged 15-19 years, one in Eastern and South-eastern Asia (Democratic Republic of Korea) and three in Europe and Northern America (Isle of Man, Saint Pierre and Miquelon, and San Marino).

Table 1: The regional breakdown of data availability is as follows:

Disaggregation:

Age, education, number of living children, marital status, socioeconomic status, geographic location and other categories, depending on the data source and number of observations.
